newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX JGBs, Euroyen firmer, generous BOJ operation.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX JGBs, Euroyen firmer, generous BOJ operation.

text.p: SIMEX Japanese government bond (JGB) and Euroyen futures were firmer in late trade on Tuesday.
Dealers said morning rumours that Japan's ministry of finance (MOF) would buy outright bonds worth about 100 billion yen fuelled a rally in JGBs.
September JGBs surged to a high of 124.65 before easing to end at 124.49 against their previous close at 124.12 after the rumours were proven unfounded.
The MOF later said it would reduce its bimonthly issue volumes of both six- and four- year JGBs to 400 billion yen each from 500 billion yen.
Dealers said the upside on JGBs was reined in Japan's uninspiring June auto sales data, which showed a five percent year-on-year decline instead of a double-digit drop.
Euroyen futures got a boost from a surprisingly generous money market operation by the Bank of Japan (BOJ) in the morning.
"It was unexpected and helped reinforce market belief of a stable rate policy in Japan," a dealer with a European institution said.
BOJ left about 390 billion yen surplus in the market after injecting 200 billion yen on Tuesday morning, dealers said.
March Euroyen was trading around 98.94 against its IMM close of 98.88. December was at 99.14 against its previous IMM close at 99.11.
The Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) meeting starting on Tuesday kept Eurodollar activity muted despite expectations that the two-day meeting would leave rates unchanged.
March Eurodollars ended at 93.795 against its previous IMM close at 93.805. Volume was at 6991 lots.
